title: How to Reset Your Google Password on Your Phone

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. You'll find this gear icon in the Quick Menu if you swipe down from the top of your screen. Alternatively, you can find the gear app icon in your app drawer or by searching.

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . It's next to an uppercase "G" on a blue background.

steps.title: Tap Manage your Google Account.
steps.content: Tap Manage your Google Account . This is next to the multicolored "G" icon under your profile picture. If you don't have a Google Account associated with your phone, you will not be able to continue.

steps.title: Tap the Security tab.
steps.content: Tap the Security tab. You may need to slide the menu left to find this option (the menu starts with the Home and Personal info tabs).

steps.title: Tap Password under "Signing in to Google.
steps.content: Tap Password under "Signing in to Google. " To find this option, you might need to scroll down the menu. Sign in with your password to continue.

steps.title: Enter the new password and tap Change Password.
steps.content: Enter the new password and tap Change Password . When you change or reset your Google password, you'll be signed out of your accounts except on devices that have special permissions (like your Chromebook).

steps.title: Open Gmail.
steps.content: Open Gmail. This app icon looks like a red and white envelope that you can find on one of your Home screens, in the Dock, or by searching.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture or initials.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture or initials. You'll see your profile picture if you selected one or your initials in the top right corner of the app.

steps.title: Tap Manage your Google Account.
steps.content: Tap Manage your Google Account . This is next to the multicolored "G" icon under your profile picture.

steps.title: Tap the Personal info tab.
steps.content: Tap the Personal info tab. It's to the right of the Home tab.

steps.title: Enter the new password and tap Change Password.
steps.content: Enter the new password and tap Change Password . When you change or reset your Google password, you'll be signed out of your accounts except on devices that have special permissions (like your Chromebook). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Forgot my password.
steps.content: Tap Forgot my password . Follow the steps to change your password on Android or iPhone to get to this screen, where you can indicate that you've forgotten your password to reset it. For Android phones and tablets, open Settings, then tap Google > Manage your Google Account > Security > Password . If you have an iPhone, open Gmail, then tap your profile picture and tap Manage your Google Account > Personal info > Password .

steps.title: Follow the on-screen steps to recover your account.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen steps to recover your account. If you don't remember your password, you'll need to either log in via a trusted device (like your Chromebook if you have 2FA enabled) or log in with a code sent via text or email.

steps.title: Log in with the email or texted code.
steps.content: Log in with the email or texted code. Depending on your method of recovery, the website will look different. If you chose to recover via email, you'll get a link in your email to use. However, if you decided to use a phone number, you'll need to enter the code sent via text into the field provided. Make sure to look in your Spam or Bulk Mail folders for the Google email.

steps.title: Enter a new password.
steps.content: Enter a new password. When you change or reset your Google password, you'll be signed out of your accounts except on devices that have special permissions (like your Chromebook).
